title: Clipper tea handwriting font (?)
content:
Anyone know what this great handwriting typeface is? Of course it may be genuinely handwritten, but here's hoping â€¦

It's tasty.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [clipper1.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20100401062211/http:/typophile.com/files/clipper1.JPG) | 30.81 KB |
| [clipper 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100401062211/http:/typophile.com/files/clipper%202.jpg) | 72.14 KB |
| [clipper 3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100401062211/http:/typophile.com/files/clipper%203.jpg) | 59.82 KB |
author: Dan Brady

comments.content:
There's about 3 fonts there. I was looking at the connected script as 'handwriting', but then I guessed you were talking about the serif and sans fonts that looked hand-drawn. Did you check out Stephen Coles' list of hand-drawn text fonts? In my Script Guide they would be found in [Part 6](http://web.archive.org/web/20100401062211/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script06Pg1.html), if I collected them.

- Mike Yanega

I do think at least the large serif lettering is a font, because I can't see differences in identical letters. The closest I found was [Jot](http://web.archive.org/web/20100401062211/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typadelic/jot/) by Ronna Penner of Typadelic. It's possible she made a custom version for this company -- it seems that close to me.

- Mike Yanega
And here is Stephen Coles' list of [Serifs by Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20100401062211/http:/typographica.org/000737.php)
